alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 12:36AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall located across Caldwell and Alexander counties will spread north into Wilkes County through 130 AM EDT... At 1233 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall extending along a line from near Hudson to near Lookout Shoals Lake. Movement was north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Very heavy rainfall. Occasional cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. Reduced visibility and poor driving conditions. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Ronda... Boomer... Wilbar... Mc Grady... and Windy Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
